subject: DB: Un-nest some returns from dbapi
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-08-23 19:48:57.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/api/controllers/v1/port.py', 'ironic/api/controllers/v1/driver.py', 'ironic/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/0e1a4df3fb4963d83949d5db1c4be64a0d640780', 'message': 'DB: Un-nest some returns from dbapi

While looking at Metal3 locking issues, I went back and looked at
the preceeding calls because post-pivot of services, the order of
operation against Ironic's API is slightly different as the nodes
are going to be moved into adoption.

The major difference is pre-pivot, we generally saw power state
synchronization occur right before the first "database is locked"
error, but in post pivot, power state sync completed earlier and
then a few different GET queries executed.

Those queries:
    GET /v1
    GET /v1/drivers
    GET /v1/nodes/<uuid>
    GET /v1/ports?fields=node_uuid&node_uuid=<uuid>

And of course, the update node then proceeded to fail because the
database was locked due to the UUID which we were just doing GETs
upon.

Digging through the sequence:
  * /v1 has no DB Queries.
  * /v1/drivers *did* end up having *two* separate queries to
    composite the results. Which led towards some slight
    structural changes to ensure we're not closing out the
    method with anything that could have a tie to the database.
  * This then looking at the db/sqlalchemy/api.py file, primarly
    because nodes has recieved quite a bit of scruitney in the
    handling of queries and responses. In this, I noticed we
    returned from within a _session_for_read with block, which
    is quite likely a root cause issue for database locking.
    Looking through, I found a few more places that were sort
    of similar in pattern, so cleaned them up as well.
  * Investigating ports, just to double check, we ended up
    assigning an node object to a variable only for the ID
    value of the node, but we didn't really need to be stored
    in memory, so I reformated a little bit so we don't have
    a variable that needs to be cleaned up later.

Change-Id: I62c12d0ec9809f3b756f1b6b796ea5dd11b3e023
'}]
commit_message:
DB: Un-nest some returns from dbapi

While looking at Metal3 locking issues, I went back and looked at
the preceeding calls because post-pivot of services, the order of
operation against Ironic's API is slightly different as the nodes
are going to be moved into adoption.

The major difference is pre-pivot, we generally saw power state
synchronization occur right before the first "database is locked"
error, but in post pivot, power state sync completed earlier and
then a few different GET queries executed.

Those queries:
    GET /v1
    GET /v1/drivers
    GET /v1/nodes/<uuid>
    GET /v1/ports?fields=node_uuid&node_uuid=<uuid>

And of course, the update node then proceeded to fail because the
database was locked due to the UUID which we were just doing GETs
upon.

Digging through the sequence:
  * /v1 has no DB Queries.
  * /v1/drivers *did* end up having *two* separate queries to
    composite the results. Which led towards some slight
    structural changes to ensure we're not closing out the
    method with anything that could have a tie to the database.
  * This then looking at the db/sqlalchemy/api.py file, primarly
    because nodes has recieved quite a bit of scruitney in the
    handling of queries and responses. In this, I noticed we
    returned from within a _session_for_read with block, which
    is quite likely a root cause issue for database locking.
    Looking through, I found a few more places that were sort
    of similar in pattern, so cleaned them up as well.
  * Investigating ports, just to double check, we ended up
    assigning an node object to a variable only for the ID
    value of the node, but we didn't really need to be stored
    in memory, so I reformated a little bit so we don't have
    a variable that needs to be cleaned up later.

Change-Id: I62c12d0ec9809f3b756f1b6b796ea5dd11b3e023
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/21/892621/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: res = [row[0] for row in query] return res # Iterate through query to get the results and build the results res = [row[0] for row in query] return res res = session.execute(q).one()[0] return res return target res = session.query(q.exists()).scalar() return res return allocation return [r[0] for r in res] return final_set
deleted_lines: return [row[0] for row in query] return [row[0] for row in query] return session.execute(q).one()[0] return target return session.query(q.exists()).scalar() return allocation return [r[0] for r in res] return final_set

commit_message:
Fix cleanup for volume backup tests

Volume backup tests create a container when swift is used as
a backup driver. This causes a failure of an object storage
test [1] as it expects no containers being present before
the testing.

This patch fixes the cleanup of volume backup tests by making
sure that containers created during testing are deleted.

The containers cleanup is called only when swift is present.
When Swift is not used as a back up driver but is present,
the cleanup tries to delete the containers anyway. This will
not cause a failure as the delete_containers function catches
the NotFound [2] error.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/src/tempest/api/object_storage/test_account_services.py#L67
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/src/tempest/api/object_storage/base.py#L50

Closes-Bug: #2028671
Change-Id: If94facd5a926f7eadd092dfc8f0368d8e4b8d630

commit_message:
Render 'identity.authenticate' meter name with correct status

jsonpath-rw-ext uses operator.add for "+" and operator.sub for "-". operator.add can do string concatenation, but operator.sub cannot do string subtraction. so the original hack does not work, perhaps we should use sub to get an empty string.

Closes-Bug: 2032882

Change-Id: I9183a4a9f9cc345d8b4508bd7de1afa0eccd89d1
(cherry picked from commit a0c56384b580a9a7f647d372e86392525b5731f3)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/99/890499/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: $.payload.outcome.`sub(/.*/, )` + 'identity.authenticate.' + $.payload.outcome

subject: Pure: Report SAM-2 addressing mode for LUNs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-02-21 19:23:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/02be1aa0be65294dbc1097a31b4b9706a3ef64e6', 'message': "Pure: Report SAM-2 addressing mode for LUNs

Pure iSCSI and FC drivers use SCSI SAM-2 addressing mode, which means
that LUNs < 256 use peripheral mode (unmodified values) and LUNs >= 256
use flat mode (2 higher bits of the MSB must be 01b).

This is not the standard behavior of os-brick, which defaults to
SAM/transparent mode.

In this patch the Pure storage driver reports it's addressing mode so
that LUNs with value greater than 255 can be connected by os-brick.

Depends-On: If32d054e8f944f162bdc8700d842134a80049877
Closes-Bug: #2006960
Change-Id: I4abfb6de58340c5ea70e7a796326f5d2089c80eb
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2023-03-10 10:52:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/cf85aa40b74eefad58288d3e1dedf9d22c605311', 'message': "Pure: Report SAM-2 addressing mode for LUNs

Change-Id: I4abfb6de58340c5ea70e7a796326f5d2089c80eb
"}]
commit_message:
Pure: Report SAM-2 addressing mode for LUNs

Pure iSCSI and FC drivers use SCSI SAM-2 addressing mode, which means
that LUNs < 256 use peripheral mode (unmodified values) and LUNs >= 256
use flat mode (2 higher bits of the MSB must be 01b).

This is not the standard behavior of os-brick, which defaults to
SAM/transparent mode.

In this patch the Pure storage driver reports it's addressing mode so
that LUNs with value greater than 255 can be connected by os-brick.

Depends-On: If32d054e8f944f162bdc8700d842134a80049877
Closes-Bug: #2006960
Change-Id: I4abfb6de58340c5ea70e7a796326f5d2089c80eb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/90/874690/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: "addressing_mode": "SAM2", "addressing_mode": "SAM2", "addressing_mode": "SAM2", "addressing_mode": "SAM2", "addressing_mode": "SAM2", "addressing_mode": "SAM2", "addressing_mode": "SAM2",

subject: Add openEuler 22.03 LTS support

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-08-18 06:19:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra/commit/91dde0f3c33a083401340c11e1b7f52f7d9192e0', 'message': 'Add openEuler 22.03 LTS support

openEuler is an open-source Linux based operating system. The current
openEuler kernel is based on Linux and supports multi arch, such as
X86_64 and aarch64. It fully unleashes the potential of computing chips.
As an efficient, stable, and secure open-source OS built by global
open-source contributors, openEuler applies to database, big data, cloud
computing, and AI scenarios. openEuler is using RPM for package
management.

This Patch add the openEuler distro support. And add the related
CI job to make sure its works well.

Website: https://www.openeuler.org/en/

As an efficient, stable, and secure open-source OS built by global
open-source contributors, openEuler applies to database, big data, cloud
computing, and AI scenarios. openEuler is using RPM for package
management.

This Patch add the openEuler distro support. And add the related
CI job to make sure its works well.

Website: https://www.openeuler.org/en/
Change-Id: Ie936a111671bedc9a14b0abbce0640e0729d03fd

commit_message:
Add openEuler 22.03 LTS support

openEuler is an open-source Linux based operating system. The current
openEuler kernel is based on Linux and supports multi arch, such as
X86_64 and aarch64. It fully unleashes the potential of computing chips.
As an efficient, stable, and secure open-source OS built by global
open-source contributors, openEuler applies to database, big data, cloud
computing, and AI scenarios. openEuler is using RPM for package
management.

This Patch add the openEuler distro support. And add the related
CI job to make sure its works well.

Website: https://www.openeuler.org/en/
Change-Id: Ie936a111671bedc9a14b0abbce0640e0729d03fd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra refs/changes/44/891944/18 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: name: openstack-helm-infra-deploy-openeuler parent: openstack-helm-infra-functional timeout: 7200 roles: - zuul: zuul/zuul-jobs pre-run: playbooks/osh-infra-upgrade-host.yaml post-run: playbooks/osh-infra-collect-logs.yaml nodeset: openstack-helm-single-node-openeuler vars: osh_params: openstack_release: xena container_distro_name: ubuntu container_distro_version: focal gate_scripts_relative_path: ../openstack-helm-infra gate_scripts: - ./tools/deployment/common/000-install-packages.sh - ./tools/gate/deploy-k8s.sh - job: name: openstack-helm-infra-aio-podsecuritypolicy parent: openstack-helm-infra-functional timeout: 7200 pre-run: - playbooks/osh-infra-upgrade-host.yaml post-run: playbooks/osh-infra-collect-logs.yaml nodeset: openstack-helm-single-node vars: gate_scripts_relative_path: ../openstack-helm-infra gate_scripts: - ./tools/deployment/podsecuritypolicy/000-install-packages.sh - ./tools/deployment/podsecuritypolicy/005-deploy-k8s.sh - ./tools/deployment/podsecuritypolicy/006-config-k8s-psp.sh - ./tools/deployment/podsecuritypolicy/007-podsecuritypolicy.sh - job:

subject: Add pre-commit config
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-05-03 07:56:13.000000000', 'files': ['.pre-commit-config.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/octavia-lib/commit/5b2a1e440445772f20be57df98d74e61c73a837f', 'message': 'Add pre-commit config

The main Octavia repository has it already and it proved to be useful
there.

Change-Id: I51e66615b6edb738b267ab4ca626a3cf12e3a8d7
'}]
commit_message:
Add pre-commit config

The main Octavia repository has it already and it proved to be useful
there.

Change-Id: I51e66615b6edb738b267ab4ca626a3cf12e3a8d7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia-lib refs/changes/27/882127/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # See https://pre-commit.com for more information # See https://pre-commit.com/hooks.html for more hooks repos: - repo: https://github.com/pre-commit/pre-commit-hooks rev: 3298ddab3c13dd77d6ce1fc0baf97691430d84b0 # v4.3.0 hooks: - id: trailing-whitespace # Replaces or checks mixed line ending - id: mixed-line-ending args: ['--fix', 'lf'] exclude: '.*\.(svg)$' - id: end-of-file-fixer # Forbid files which have a UTF-8 byte-order marker - id: check-byte-order-marker # Checks that non-binary executables have a proper shebang - id: check-executables-have-shebangs # Check for files that contain merge conflict strings. - id: check-merge-conflict - id: debug-statements - id: check-yaml files: .*\.(yaml|yml)$ - id: check-added-large-files - repo: local hooks: - id: flake8 name: flake8 additional_dependencies: - hacking>=3.1.0,<3.2.0 language: python entry: flake8 files: '^.*\.py$' exclude: '^(doc|releasenotes|tools)/.*$'

subject: tox: Remove basepython
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-08-02 09:00:49.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs/commit/ebeabb0df60d82cbd119e555f85fb4c13ba275c1', 'message': "tox: Remove basepython

Python 2 is EOL. No environment should be defaulting to it. Our CI
environments certainly aren't.

Change-Id: Ie3ba58bf0d4f33e47d5563de131ac126507c516c
"}]
commit_message:

commit_message:
NVMe-oF: Create /etc/nvme/hostid

The NVMe-oF connector currently create the `/etc/nvme/hostnqn` file if
it doesn't exist, but it may still be missing the `/etc/nvme/hostid`
value.

Some distribution packages create the file on installation but others
may not.

It is recommended for the file to be present so that nvme doesn't
randomly generate it.

Randomly generating it means that the value will be different for the
same storage array and the same volume if we connect, disconnect, and
connect the volume again.

This patch ensures that the file will exist and will try to use the
system's UUID as reported by DMI or a randomly generated one.

Closes-Bug: #2016029
Change-Id: I0b60f9078f23f8464d8234841645ed520e8ba655
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-brick refs/changes/22/880222/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from __future__ import annotations from typing import Optional # noqa: H301 @os_brick.privileged.default.entrypoint def create_hostid(uuid: Optional[str]) -> Optional[str]: """Create the hostid to ensure it's always the same. If no uuid is passed in, then we will generate a random one. """ try: os.makedirs('/etc/nvme', mode=0o755, exist_ok=True) with open('/etc/nvme/hostid', 'w') as f: LOG.debug('Writing nvme hostid %s', uuid) f.write(f'{uuid}\n') os.chmod('/etc/nvme/hostid', 0o644) except Exception as e: LOG.warning("Could not generate nvme host id: %s", e) return None return uuid

commit_message:
WIP Retry router creation.

After image import, it seems that neutron can take a long time to
report router creation, so instead of failing we retry.

We don't do it when we are in sanityfast mode.

Change-Id: Iccc720f13762b2ab0906f77e40593d3e1f9abe6b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-upgrade refs/changes/64/888064/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: function os_cmd_retry { local expect="${1:-}" # string which must be found in the output local cmd="${2:-}" # of that command. shift 2 local cmd_output="" local retries=3 local failed=false if [[ "${MODE}" != "sanityfast" ]] && \ [ -n "${expect}" -a -n "${cmd}" ] && \ [[ "${cmd}" =~ ^openstack ]]; then openstack "$@" cmd_output="$(${cmd})" while [ $retries -gt 0 ]; do if ! echo "${cmd_output}" | grep -q "${expect}"; then echo "Retrying ($((retries-1)) left) openstack $@" openstack "$@" sleep 60 retries=$((retries-1)) failed=true else failed=false continue fi done if failed; then echo "Tried ${retries} times to 'openstack $@' without success." exit 1 fi else os_cmd "$@" fi } os_cmd_retry "internal_net_${TENANT_NET_NAME}_router" "openstack router list" \ router create ${TENANT_NET_NAME}_router

commit_message:
Correct [pci] syntax in Nova SRIOV documentation

The ``[pci]`` options in the Nova SRIOV documentation are incorrect.
``alias`` is a JSON object but mentioned as a list of object here.

Closes-Bug: #2019985
Change-Id: I4f9bce297bc3385f9749e4221f4721c1841700a1
(cherry picked from commit d30d1fd655f6e82e53ddc9704dcec2331f4579e0)

Fix improper designate-manage command usage.

  * Implicit use of default pools file path.
  * Use non-destructive update operation.

commit_message:
Release final os-ken for 2023.2 Bobcat

This proposed a release for os-ken to get any final merged
changes out prior to the lib freeze for 2023.2 Bobcat going into effect.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday, August 25th.

e9dc289d Make neutron-dynamic-routing job non-voting

commit_message:
Release final osc-lib for 2023.2 Bobcat

This proposed a release for osc-lib to get any final merged
changes out prior to the lib freeze for 2023.2 Bobcat going into effect.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the

commit_message:
docs: Clarify lack of LDAP assignment back end

The LDAP assignment backend was removed in Mitaka(!) [1] and should no
longer be referenced.

Change-Id: I14a4d7fdbaee81792a1ccf9b3bcf5f2d8e237da5
(cherry picked from commit dabaef7c331fbd0f5f66b9d98b0d03bb140e2a1e)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/97/890497/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: by each domain or the OpenStack Identity service entirely. This is supported by the LDAP identity back end.authorization using the OpenStack Identity service SQL database. There is no assignment back end for LDAP.
deleted_lines: by each domain or the OpenStack Identity service entirely.authorization using the OpenStack Identity service SQL database, while providing user authentication through the LDAP directory. .. NOTE:: It is possible to isolate identity related information to LDAP in a deployment and keep resource information in a separate datastore. It is not possible to do the opposite, where resource information is stored in LDAP and identity information is stored in SQL. If the resource or assignment back ends are integrated with LDAP, the identity back end must also be integrated with LDAP.

subject: Do not retry immediately after server fault
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-08-09 12:28:29.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/lib/common/utils/test_utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/be7bed4de28dd722ae91a53ed1d81f7449eb6ba0', 'message': "Do not retry immediately after server fault

Currently the call_and_ignore_notfound_exc method retries API request
immediately after it receives server failure. However this is not much
robust because retries might be done in a quite short span.

For example in the related bug we've seen that glance-api with cinder
backend needs some time to complete the post tasks to disconnect
the volume when it's run by httpd + mod_wsgi. Currently the 3 delete
calls are executed within 1 second and that is not enough to complete
that task.

This adds 1 second delay between reties, assuming longer delay would
help the server stabilize.

Related-Bug: #2030855
Change-Id: Ic9eed8352c64f183ca4077e141c6b94f81a9b91a
"}]
commit_message:
Do not retry immediately after server fault

Currently the call_and_ignore_notfound_exc method retries API request
immediately after it receives server failure. However this is not much
robust because retries might be done in a quite short span.

For example in the related bug we've seen that glance-api with cinder
backend needs some time to complete the post tasks to disconnect
the volume when it's run by httpd + mod_wsgi. Currently the 3 delete
calls are executed within 1 second and that is not enough to complete
that task.

This adds 1 second delay between reties, assuming longer delay would
help the server stabilize.

Related-Bug: #2030855
Change-Id: Ic9eed8352c64f183ca4077e141c6b94f81a9b91a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/11/890911/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: time.sleep(1)

commit_message:
SCSI: Support non SAM LUN addressing

This patch adds non SAM addressing modes for LUNs, specifically for
SAM-2 and SAM-3 flat addressing.

Code has been manually verified on Pure storage systems that uses SAM-2
addressing mode, because it's unusual for CI jobs to have more than
256 LUNs on a single target.

Closes-Bug: #2006960
Change-Id: If32d054e8f944f162bdc8700d842134a80049877

commit_message:
Default os-assisted-volume-snapshots APIs to service role

RBAC community wide goal phase-2[1] is to add service
role for the service APIs policy rule. os-assisted-volume-snapshots
APIs are meant to be used by the OpenStack internal services
only. Default both create and delete APIs policy to service role.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/892638

Partial implement blueprint policy-service-role-default

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/consistent-and-secure-rbac.html#phase-2

Change-Id: I7178194b2566728a283816c9c5f7f36373070a06

Add 'service' role in this policy so that cinder # can call it with user having 'service' role (not having # correct project_id). That is for phase-2 of RBAC goal and until # then, we keep it open for all admin in any project. We cannot # default it to ADMIN which has the project_id in # check_str and will fail if cinder call it with other project_id. check_str=base.ADMIN, # TODO(gmann): This is internal API policy and called by # cinder. commit_message:
Add service role in server_external_events API

RBAC community wide goal phase-2[1] is to add service
role for the service APIs policy rule. server_external_events
API is meant to be used by the OpenStack internal services
only. Default this API policy to service role.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/892640

Partial implement blueprint policy-service-role-default

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/consistent-and-secure-rbac.html#phase-2

Change-Id: I878fea25e015824301aaaabfd38756873d72b2c1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/33/892633/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: check_str=base.SERVICE,
deleted_lines: # TODO(gmann): This is internal API policy and supposed to be called # by neutron, cinder, ironic, and cyborg (may be other openstack # services in future). Add 'service' role in this policy so that # neutron can call it with user having 'service' role (not having # server's project_id). That is for phase-2 of RBAC goal and until # then, we keep it open for all admin in any project. We cannot # default it to ADMIN which has the project_id in # check_str and will fail if neutron call it with other project_id. check_str=base.ADMIN,

commit_message:
Make tests work with pytest runner

pytest considers classes with names starting with Test
as test classes and tried to run those.
This patch renames base classes that
should not run directly.

Partial-Bug: #2017973
Change-Id: I86e50b9d3070e757f1bba8b390c8b7557e41a325

commit_message:
Remove ovsdbapp-tempest-dsvm-networking-ovn-ovs-release job definition

Parent of this job (networking-ovn-tempest-dsvm-ovs-release) was defined
in the networking-ovn repo in stable/train branch which is now EOL.
Because of that this is now causing zuul config error as
networking-ovn-tempest-dsvm-ovs-release don't exists anymore.
Lets delete ovsdbapp-tempest-dsvm-networking-ovn-ovs-release job
definition and keep just basic jobs in stable/train branch.

Additionally this patch pinned OVS and OVN branch in the functional
tests job to the same versions as were used in the networking-ovn jobs
in stable/train branch.

Change-Id: If5bb7e03cb5098f34c29ee620867c341d3ec078f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ovsdbapp refs/changes/59/892459/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: - job: name: ovsdbapp-tempest-dsvm-networking-ovn-ovs-release description: Job testing for devstack/tempest testing networking-ovn with the latest released OVN branch and ovsdbapp from source parent: networking-ovn-tempest-dsvm-ovs-release vars: devstack_localrc: LIBS_FROM_GIT: ovsdbapp USE_PYTHON3: true

Add support for HTTP Strict Transport Security

Changes needed in order to use new HSTS support in Octavia.

added_lines: parser.add_argument( '--enable-hsts', dest='hsts_enabled', action='store_true', help="Enables HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS) for the " "TLS-terminated listener." ) parser.add_argument( '--hsts-header-opts', dest='hsts_header_opts', metavar='<hsts_header_opts>', nargs='?', help="Options of the Strict-Transport-Security header. E.g. " "'max-age=16000000; includeSubDomains; preload;'. Note that " "max-age is a mandatory field for using the HSTS feature." )

commit_message:
Dell PowerFlex: Unnecessary login happen

This patch fixes the Dell PowerFlex (scaleio) connector for os-brick
and enables the token to get cached and reusable. It avoids
unnecessary logins. If the token already exists, then it get cached
for future use.

Closes-Bug: #2004630
Change-Id: I2399b0b2af8254cd5697b44dcfcec553c2845bec
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-brick refs/changes/84/876284/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.server_password, server_token = self._get_password_token( if server_token: self.server_token = server_token

subject: Update documents for change in change-vnfpkg
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-08-24 00:22:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tacker/commit/7729e4591e03c16c79e856a8c2ec8f7d33450568', 'message': 'Update documents for change in change-vnfpkg

This patch updates the vnflcm update and vnflcm change-vnfpkg
use case guides and "vnflcm op show" and vnflcm op list
API reference for Bobcat.
These updates include changes in the following patch.
* Fix missing modificationsTriggeredByVnfPkgChange [1]

The main fixes in this patch are as follows.
* Add "vnflcm update" use case guide for CNF
* Add how to update metadata/extensions/vnfConfigurableProperties
* Add note about extManagedVirtualLinks of ChangeCurrentVnfPkgRequest
* Add modificationTriggeredByVnfPkgChange to VnfLcmOpOcc
* Change vdu_params to required parameter

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tacker/+/880129

commit_message:
Update documents for change in change-vnfpkg

This patch updates the vnflcm update and vnflcm change-vnfpkg
use case guides and "vnflcm op show" and vnflcm op list
API reference for Bobcat.
These updates include changes in the following patch.
* Fix missing modificationsTriggeredByVnfPkgChange [1]

The main fixes in this patch are as follows.
* Add "vnflcm update" use case guide for CNF
* Add how to update metadata/extensions/vnfConfigurableProperties
* Add note about extManagedVirtualLinks of ChangeCurrentVnfPkgRequest
* Add modificationTriggeredByVnfPkgChange to VnfLcmOpOcc
* Change vdu_params to required parameter

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tacker/+/880129

Closes-Bug: #2015941
Change-Id: I5a50ed88621ec7d2f82eb1f6d844d0ad5adae544

commit_message:
Add docs key and point at Discourse

Add the 'docs' key and point it at a Discourse topic
previously populated with the charm's README contents.

When the new charm revision is released to the Charmhub,
this Discourse-based content will be displayed there. In
the absense of the this new key, the Charmhub's default
behaviour is to display the value of the charm's
'description' key.

Change-Id: Ic11a02b94cb9708a8b830942264e5ee80b748a5e

commit_message:
Do not change ownership recursive for Swift

Changing ownership recursive was required when deployments upgraded from
baremetal to containerized deployments. However, by now all deployments
should be containerized, and running chown recursive against a large
amount of data might timeout during upgrades.

Additionally temporary files might disappear while running chown and
chown exits with an error, breaking the update.

Therefore removing the recursive option, and only set the ownership for
the main and director subdirectores (which might include newly added
disk mountpoints). In the rare circumstance where this might be still
needed it is more safe to run this manually instead of breaking upgrades
for everyone else.

Conflicts:
	deployment/swift/swift-storage-container-puppet.yaml

Resolved conflict caused by 12bdd6feb445b3a60ff0f981db66c829e0cf5875
which is only present for stable/train.

Closes-Bug: 1988441
Closes-Bug: 1988453
Change-Id: If59a3d4cf77a6995d60fc2db7f21739cac5f72aa
(cherry picked from commit 52c95b1d15631aff22d9d9efd943144676b44f8b)
(cherry picked from commit b2b3d95222a650187bf7b04d74145fb75549b21c)

commit_message:
Fix glance-remote with global venv

The base systemd unit file setup now writes an Environment= line to
the file for the venv. The glance-remote code was setting that to
point at the alternate config location, using iniset which was
clobbering the venv one. Switch to iniadd to fix.

Also, we need to explicitly put the --venv flag into the command since
we write our unit file ourselves. This probably needs a cleanup at
this point, but since the glance gate is blocked, do this for now.

Change-Id: I2bd33de45c41b18ed7d4270a7301b1e322134987

commit_message:
Add service role context in policy tests

RBAC community wide goal phase-2[1] is to add service
role for the service APIs policy rule. This commit
adds the service role context in policy tests. This
will help to know what all permission service role has
now and what all it will have when we will add service
role as default in the service-to-service APIs

Partial implement blueprint policy-service-role-default

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/consistent-and-secure-rbac.html#phase-2

Change-Id: Ic278fa10dc811a26cf0c53b2d234ed0b410754f8

subject: RBD: Improve close and flush in IOWrapper
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-09-13 11:29:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-brick/commit/5f3c1faa8763187bfd147a84b993eceb62a80bd2', 'message': "RBD: Improve close and flush in IOWrapper

On Change-Id Ib3b066a7da071b1c2de78a1a4e569676539bd335 we improved the
RBDVolumeIOWrapper's flush and close methods, and this patch improves
them even further.

There are cases where the caller may call close on the Image that the
IOWrapper is wrapping instead of calling the close on the IOWrapper
itself.  In those cases the IOWrapper will think that it's still open
and will try to close the image if close is called (explicitly or by the
Garbage Collector).

In this patch we add checks to skip calling the Image's flush and close
methods when the Image has been removed.

Change-Id: Ib5a517d58427df0d1d1b22ad3dc66f673da147fe
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2023-02-08 10:44:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-brick/commit/a9ea965e4a4b2e2d1bbdb7190fc3ef8fba98e5be', 'message': "RBD: Improve close and flush in IOWrapper

On Change-Id Ib3b066a7da071b1c2de78a1a4e569676539bd335 we improved the
RBDVolumeIOWrapper's flush and close methods, and this patch improves
them even further.

If the IOWrapper's close is not explicitly called and it's just
dereferenced (happens in unit tests) then during Garbage Collection the
wrapped image may be destroyed before the wrapper, which would trigger
the image being closed without the wrapper knowing, so when the wrapper
gets destroyed it will fail because it calls its close method, which
calls its flush, which calls the underlying image's flush, which will
fail because the underlying image was already closed.

We need to check if the underlying image has already being flushed
before calling the flush.

Calling the underlying close method for the Image or IOWrapper classes
is not a problem because they are idempotent.

Change-Id: Ib5a517d58427df0d1d1b22ad3dc66f673da147fe

before calling the flush.

Calling the underlying close method for the Image or IOWrapper classes
is not a problem because they are idempotent.

Change-Id: Ib5a517d58427df0d1d1b22ad3dc66f673da147fe

commit_message:
RBD: Improve close and flush in IOWrapper

On Change-Id Ib3b066a7da071b1c2de78a1a4e569676539bd335 we improved the
RBDVolumeIOWrapper's flush and close methods, and this patch improves
them even further.

If the IOWrapper's close is not explicitly called and it's just
dereferenced (happens in unit tests) then during Garbage Collection the
wrapped image may be destroyed before the wrapper, which would trigger
the image being closed without the wrapper knowing, so when the wrapper
gets destroyed it will fail because it calls its close method, which
calls its flush, which calls the underlying image's flush, which will
fail because the underlying image was already closed.

We need to check if the underlying image has already being flushed
before calling the flush.

Calling the underlying close method for the Image or IOWrapper classes
is not a problem because they are idempotent.

Change-Id: Ib5a517d58427df0d1d1b22ad3dc66f673da147fe
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-brick refs/changes/47/857347/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove a lazy load on every server show

Right now our server show operation ends up lazy-loading the fault
and service fields from the instance instead of querying them with
the instance itself. Fault generates a failure during query if we
don't have one (which we should fix) but at least we can avoid the
services load.

Change-Id: Ib551a778438e079e19e53510cabcfa4a57202ce3

commit_message:
api-ref update: Move the service APIs in a separate section

This is moving all the service APIs in a separate section of
api-ref. Also, separating the volume update(swap) API into new
file which is added under the new service API section.

Implement blueprint policy-service-role-default

Change-Id: I5867d381eda03bdd4530d6c17b8e13edeaf76ec3

added_lines: Friends and Colleagues, I would like to submit my candidacy to serve as Ironic PTL for the 2024.1 cycle. If elected, this will be my third cycle as PTL of Ironic. I'm happy to continue to serve the community if you will have me. Thanks, Jay Faulkner IRC: JayF

commit_message:
Fix error message from share server API

Fixing share server api error message when share network
does not exist.

Closes-bug: #2025649
Change-Id: I19a2f7dbb2375b2d3a281efa673da986f29aa9d6
(cherry picked from commit 456b90898f6a7b1a4bc29170deaf9d6c40c138f7)
(cherry picked from commit bc2e30390468e066d328680a87dab8e06a0f524d)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/84/892584/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: msg = _("Share server could not be found. Its associated share " "network %s does not exist.") % server['share_network_id']
deleted_lines: msg = _("Share server %s could not be found. Its associated " "share network does not " "exist.") % server['share_network_id']

added_lines: - job: name: nova-raw-images-with-resize parent: devstack-tempest irrelevant-files: *nova-base-irrelevant-files required-projects: - openstack/nova vars: # We use the "all" environment for tempest_test_regex and # tempest_exclude_regex. tox_envlist: all # Run all compute API tests and most scenario tests at the default # concurrency (nproc/2 which is normally 4 in the gate). tempest_test_regex: ^tempest\.(scenario|api\.compute) devstack_local_conf: post-config: $NOVA_CPU_CONF: libvirt: images_type: raw test-config: $TEMPEST_CONFIG: compute-feature-enabled: resize: true devstack_localrc: DEVSTACK_PARALLEL: True devstack_services: c-bak: false s-account: false s-container: false s-object: false s-proxy: false - nova-raw-images-with-resize
deleted_lines: templates: - check-requirements - integrated-gate-compute - openstack-cover-jobs - openstack-python3-jobs - openstack-python3-jobs-arm64 - periodic-stable-jobs - publish-openstack-docs-pti - release-notes-jobs-python3 # We define our own irrelevant-files so we don't run the job # on things like nova docs-only changes. - ironic-tempest-ipa-wholedisk-bios-agent_ipmitool-tinyipa: voting: false irrelevant-files: *nova-base-irrelevant-files - nova-ceph-multistore: irrelevant-files: *nova-base-irrelevant-files - neutron-linuxbridge-tempest: irrelevant-files: # NOTE(mriedem): This job has its own irrelevant-files section # so that we only run it on changes to networking and libvirt/vif # code; we don't need to run this on all changes. - ^(?!nova/network/.*)(?!nova/virt/libvirt/vif.py).*$ - nova-live-migration - nova-live-migration-ceph - nova-lvm - nova-multi-cell - nova-next - nova-ovs-hybrid-plug - nova-tox-validate-backport: voting: false - nova-tox-functional-py38 - nova-tox-functional-py39 - nova-tox-functional-py310: voting: true - openstack-tox-py310: voting: true - tempest-integrated-compute: # NOTE(gmann): Policies changes do not need to run all the # integration test jobs. Running only tempest and grenade # common jobs will be enough along with nova functional # and unit tests. irrelevant-files: &policies-irrelevant-files - ^api-.*$ - ^(test-|)requirements.txt$ - ^.*\.rst$ - ^.git.*$ - ^doc/.*$ - ^nova/hacking/.*$ - ^nova/locale/.*$ - ^nova/tests/.*$ - ^nova/test.py$ - ^releasenotes/.*$ - ^setup.cfg$ - ^tools/.*$ - ^tox.ini$ - grenade-skip-level: irrelevant-files: *policies-irrelevant-files - nova-grenade-multinode: irrelevant-files: *policies-irrelevant-files - tempest-ipv6-only: irrelevant-files: *nova-base-irrelevant-files - openstacksdk-functional-devstack: irrelevant-files: *nova-base-irrelevant-files - cyborg-tempest: irrelevant-files: *nova-base-irrelevant-files voting: false - barbican-tempest-plugin-simple-crypto: irrelevant-files: *nova-base-irrelevant-files voting: false

subject: Desigante: add DNS listen IPs to allow-notify list
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-07-18 17:02:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/2026506e61116d8439131148151899a04478f4cd', 'message': 'Desigante: add DNS listen IPs to allow-notify list

The designate worker sends notify DNS messages to all of the bind
instances and under some circumstances, these messages will appear to
originate on the extra DNS bind address.

Related-bug: #2027608
Change-Id: I0cc4c91e4708221fc429a8f760f08830fe6db220
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2023-07-18 17:03:49.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/designate/designate-bind-container.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/95535598b989b840cf577a257fdd70a85645a990', 'message': 'Desigante: add DNS listen IPs to allow-notify list

The designate worker sends notify DNS messages to all of the bind
instances and under some circumstances, these messages will appear to
originate on the extra DNS bind address. This patch adds the extra IP
to the allow-notify list in all of the deployed bind configurations.

Related-bug: #2027608

'}]
commit_message:
Desigante: add DNS listen IPs to allow-notify list

The designate worker sends notify DNS messages to all of the bind
instances and under some circumstances, these messages will appear to
originate on the extra DNS bind address. This patch adds the extra IP
to the allow-notify list in all of the deployed bind configurations.

Related-bug: #2027608
Change-Id: I0cc4c91e4708221fc429a8f760f08830fe6db220
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/86/888786/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: distribute listen IPs for configuring allow-notify list set_fact: tripleo_other_allow_notify: "{{ dns_listen_ips }}" delegate_facts: true delegate_to: "{{ item }}" loop: "{{ groups['designate_bind'] | difference(groups['excluded_overcloud']) }}"

commit_message:
Fix the issue of losing nf_conntrace* values after a reboot.

Loading ip_vs module before setting nf_conntrace_* opts.

Story: 2010795
Task: 48247
Change-Id: Ie4763e97b1414e9871f222c20efd0f532b3dfc9f

commit_message:
Add '--count' option for snapshot list API.

Added support for display count info in share snapshot list
and detail APIs:

1. /v2/snapshots?with_count=True
2. /v2/snapshots/detail?with_count=True

Microversion upgraded to 2.79

Related-Bug: #2024556
Depends-On: I37d8ca9022e2ea2c107c6695e20e951d7950043a
Change-Id: I230c2195c414eec28ebc5e5e9714726731307a95

commit_message:
Fix quota error messages

The quota error/warning messages displayed type(_class) which was
translated to <class 'type'>. Now the messages are fixed and display
helpful logs:
  Quota decrement on <class 'octavia.common.data_models.L7Policy'> called
  on project

Related-Bug: #2015050

Change-Id: I40797443afe789021f3697fd779ce9f3aa3d4815
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/78/879278/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | Fixed the format of log messages related to quota decrement errors. They displayed unhelpful information, they now report the correct resource type for which the error occurs.

commit_message:
Fix health message format for v2 and v3 in unit tests

Starting from the message format v2 the 'pools' is a top level field
of the message health check dict (unlike v1 format where 'pools' are
a nested dict of listeners). Fix the structure to match the health
check format to avoid misunderstanding.

Also remove unsed self.listener_stats_dict.

Closes-Bug: #2023383
Signed-off-by: Anton Kurbatov <Anton.Kurbatov@acronis.com>
Change-Id: I4777503acc10f43c7aa67bdd5d0db99e5dbdb066
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/49/885749/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: } }, "pools": { "pool-id-1:{}".format(self.listener_id): { "status": constants.UP, "members": {"member-id-1": constants.ONLINE} "pools": { "pool-id-1:{}".format(self.listener_id): { "status": constants.UP, "members": {"member-id-1": constants.ONLINE} } },
deleted_lines: self.listener_stats_dict = { self.listener_id: { "request_errors": self.listener_stats.request_errors, "active_connections": self.listener_stats.active_connections, "total_connections": self.listener_stats.total_connections, "bytes_in": self.listener_stats.bytes_in, "bytes_out": self.listener_stats.bytes_out, } } "pools": { "pool-id-1:{}".format(self.listener_id): { "status": constants.UP, "members": {"member-id-1": constants.ONLINE} } } }, "pools": { "pool-id-1:{}".format(self.listener_id): { "status": constants.UP, "members": {"member-id-1": constants.ONLINE} }

commit_message:
Mock access to tuned active_profile file in unittests

In some environments /etc/tuned/active_profile may be present, and then
running unittests in such an environment can result in an failure. This
patch mocks access to /etc/tuned/active_profile. file in two test cases
test_compile_amphora_details{_for_ipvs}

Closes-Bug: #2023384
Signed-off-by: Anton Kurbatov <Anton.Kurbatov@acronis.com>
Change-Id: I43416b32b9bef359f7ae7885353721e73a48e006
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/50/885750/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix IPv6 session persistence failed

When an IPv6 load balancer is created, and the pool is enabled with
SOURCE IP session persistence, it does not work because the stick
table only records IPv4 addresses. However, an IPv6 stick table can
record both IPv4 and IPv6 addresses.

Closes-Bug: #2027934

Change-Id: I1c51a5d6d6593108f431809868dcdb3d4142df45

commit_message:
Provide Amphora stats for Octavia no-op drivers

So far, when Octavia was either running with noop drivers or deployed
an LB (and amphora) without a listener, there were no amphora statistics
data provided.

This patch adds empty statistics to amphora for those scenarios.

Closes-Bug: #2030774
Change-Id: Ib65e459bcd10a5ab877c0cf6f234d634d25d1e55
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/14/890814/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Fake Amphora stats if noop if (constants.AMPHORAV2 in CONF.api_settings.enabled_provider_drivers and constants.VOLUME_NOOP_DRIVER in CONF.controller_worker.volume_driver): stats = { 'active_connections': 0, 'bytes_in': 0, 'bytes_out': 0, 'request_errors': 0, 'total_connections': 0 } else: stats = self.repositories.get_amphora_stats(context.session, self.amp_id)

commit_message:
Adds a new Manila driver for Dell PowerFlex storage backend

Adds a new Manila driver to support Dell PowerFlex storage backend.
It will include the minimum set of Manila features.

Implements: blueprint dell-powerflex-manila-driver
Change-Id: I4dc81bf75135b32f1971ca21eee298bca33441cf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/27/880527/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: powerflex = manila.share.drivers.dell_emc.plugins.powerflex.connection:PowerFlexStorageConnection

commit_message:
Add is_nest property for container_skel

The main purpose of that patch is to allow creation of "virtual"
container_skel, that will not generate any containers in inventory,
but will contain all containers of corresponsive hosts. That might be
useful in usecases like AZs, or when deployer simply wants to create
custom groups and include all bare metal hosts along with all
containers on them to the same group. Such behaviour can be triggered
when empty belongs_to is provided for container_skel along with is_nest
property. Then container_skel item will contain host-containers and it's
children.

Change-Id: Ic5570bfe9f0f54d1ea1e067834c11e6c390a2686
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/16/886316/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: contains_in = value.get('contains', list()) belongs_to_in = value.get('belongs_to', list()) properties = value.get('properties', {}) if properties.get('is_nest', False): physical_host_type = '{}_hosts'.format(key.split('_')[0]) for host_type in inventory[physical_host_type]['hosts']: container_mapping = inventory[key]['children'] host_type_containers = '{}-host_containers'.format(host_type) if host_type_containers in inventory: du.append_if(array=container_mapping, item=host_type_containers) <<<<<<< HEAD (5c4a61 Bump OpenStack-Ansible SHAs for Zed)======= for assignment in contains_in: for container_type in belongs_to_in: _add_container_hosts( assignment, config, key, container_type, inventory, properties ) cidr_networks = config.get('cidr_networks') provider_queues = {} for net_name in cidr_networks: ip_q = ip.load_optional_q( cidr_networks, cidr_name=net_name ) provider_queues[net_name] = ip_q if ip_q is not None: net = netaddr.IPNetwork(cidr_networks.get(net_name)) q_netmask = '{}_netmask'.format(net_name) provider_queues[q_netmask] = str(net.netmask) overrides = config.get('global_overrides', dict()) # subject: Fix missing cinder volume backend for ceph
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-08-22 21:38:26.000000000', 'files': ['multi-node-aio/playbooks/osa/openstack_user_config.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-ops/commit/12e85362a6ebf73c9a8935631c4e0d6166dcb254', 'message': 'Fix missing cinder volume backend for ceph

- Adding cinder-volume on infra-hosts once ceph is enabled

commit_message:
Fix missing cinder volume backend for ceph

- Adding cinder-volume on infra-hosts once ceph is enabled
- Fix missing osa_no_containers default value of false

Change-Id: Id7898c9dff84cbb981c9c0c916a65abcc5256dfd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-ops refs/changes/22/892422/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {% if osa_no_containers | default(false) | bool %}{% else %} # cinder volume on infra hosts (ceph) storage_hosts: *infra_block

commit_message:
tests: Disable policy deprecation warnings

Change-Id: I8d2710ac7275916bedf186131e5b0f88743c37c1
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican refs/changes/14/880814/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def init(suppress_deprecation_warnings=False): """Init an Enforcer class. :param suppress_deprecation_warnings: Whether to suppress the deprecation warnings. """ # NOTE(gmann): Explictly disable the warnings for policies # changing their default check_str. During policy-defaults-refresh # work, all the policy defaults have been changed and warning for # each policy started filling the logs limit for various tool. # Once we move to new defaults only world then we can enable these # warning again. ENFORCER.suppress_default_change_warnings = True if suppress_deprecation_warnings: ENFORCER.suppress_deprecation_warnings = True

commit_message:
Set GLOBAL_VENV to false for centos and rocky

As a temporary workaround, let's set the GLOBAL_VENV to false
specifically for centos 9 stream and rocky distros where we
encountered issues after changing the default value
of GLOBAL_VENV to True in Devstack:
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/558930

Related-Bug: #2031639
Change-Id: I708b5a81c32b0bd650dcd63a51e16346863a6fc0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/95/892395/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: function fixup_centos_stream { # remove once this is fixed # https://bugs.launchpad.net/devstack/+bug/2031639 GLOBAL_VENV=False } function fixup_rocky { # remove once this is fixed # https://bugs.launchpad.net/devstack/+bug/2031639 GLOBAL_VENV=False } fixup_centos_stream fixup_rocky

commit_message:
Not let empty param file

The overcloud upgrade prepare does not like
empty files. The CI gate does not check whether
the env files are empty. This ensure that the
files are not empty

Change-Id: I0d794ce06b4929068ff848bea88c93bd4632bd26

subject: Changed the DEFAULT_COMPUTE_API_VERSION value in the constants.py
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-08-23 15:12:40.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_common/constants.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common/commit/df8edc662feebd6700618a5d68d7c966ecae9256', 'message': "Changed the DEFAULT_COMPUTE_API_VERSION value in the constants.py

The default value defined for the variable DEFAULT_COMPUTE_API_VERSION
in the ~/.overcloudrc file generated by overcloudrc.py, which pulls
this variable value from constants.py, is '2.latest', but this
generates a warning message everytime a user uses this standard config
file, like this one below:

/usr/lib/python3.9/site-packages/openstack/config/cloud_region.py:452:
UserWarning: You have a configured API_VERSION with 'latest' in it.
In the context of openstacksdk this doesn't make any sense.
  warnings.warn(

To avoid that, I changed the value '2.latest' to simply '2.1',
which is the current API version in use after a fresh install.

Change-Id: Idbcfbf29626d9a66427b78067813915caf0e9cd5
Signed-off-by: Alexon Oliveira <alolivei@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Changed the DEFAULT_COMPUTE_API_VERSION value in the constants.py

The default value defined for the variable DEFAULT_COMPUTE_API_VERSION
in the ~/.overcloudrc file generated by overcloudrc.py, which pulls
this variable value from constants.py, is '2.latest', but this
generates a warning message everytime a user uses this standard config
file, like this one below:

/usr/lib/python3.9/site-packages/openstack/config/cloud_region.py:452:
UserWarning: You have a configured API_VERSION with 'latest' in it.
In the context of openstacksdk this doesn't make any sense.
  warnings.warn(

To avoid that, I changed the value '2.latest' to simply '2.1',
which is the current API version in use after a fresh install.

Change-Id: Idbcfbf29626d9a66427b78067813915caf0e9cd5
Signed-off-by: Alexon Oliveira <alolivei@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/48/892548/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: DEFAULT_COMPUTE_API_VERSION = '2.1'

commit_message:
Add pytest testenv to tox.ini

Pytest is a much better test runner than stestr especially while
developing and debugging tests.

Partial-Bug: #2017973
Change-Id: Ifd5b5f9633eb4282b13988233a5822a44fe7c651
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/39/881739/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Uses pytest [testenv:pytest-unit] deps = -c{env:TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE:https://releases.openstack.org/constraints/upper/master} -r{toxinidir}/requirements.txt -r{toxinidir}/test-requirements.txt pytest pytest-xdist commands = pytest {toxinidir}/octavia/tests/unit --ff -n 2 {posargs} [testenv:pytest-func] deps = -c{env:TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE:https://releases.openstack.org/constraints/upper/master} -r{toxinidir}/requirements.txt -r{toxinidir}/test-requirements.txt pytest pytest-xdist commands = pytest {toxinidir}/octavia/tests/functional --ff {posargs}

commit_message:
Remove sqlalchemy-tips from the generic tips template

octavia-tox-tips is used by multiple projects (octavia, octavia-lib) and
running sqlalchemy-tips sometimes doesn't make sense.

* Remove sqlalchemy-tips from it.
* Create a new octavia-tox-sqlalchemy-tips template for sqlalchemy and
  use it in octavia.

Change-Id: I640e6ce0469ea8051988110580213b8f2d6a2460
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/50/892550/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - project-template: name: octavia-tox-sqlalchemy-tips check: jobs:

commit_message:
Update the default etcd3gw endpoint to v3

* Recent versions of etcd no longer support the /v3alpha/ endpoint
* It's probably better to skip directly to the /v3/ endpoint
  as a default.
* Note that this probably means a new minor version of tooz, while
  the behaviour can be worked around in config, this is enough to
  break existing systems on upgrade.
* Updated the test to test backwards compatibility.
* Updated the tests to use etcd 3.3.27, unfortunately we need
  a newer version of pifpaf that supports 3.4 before the default
  api can be used.
* The etcd backend tests have been removed: the deprecated backend
  uses the v2 api which is no longer provided - a future commit
  should remove the deprecated backend. The etcd3gw backend is the
  replacement.

This fix is required in pifpaf, but it's not in any release:
https://github.com/jd/pifpaf/commit/7496e5e1c3d890eadcc491f2bcc1160d9395d8b0

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/891353
Change-Id: Ibb5e587f6b1348794b1bf4d6405bc4a32a653c2c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tooz refs/changes/55/891355/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- upgrade: - | This version of tooz defaults to the `v3` endpoint for the `etcd3gw` backend. The previous behavior can be restored by appending `?api_version=v3alpha` to the coordination URL. The `v3alpha` and `v3beta` endpoints have been deprecated by upstream etcd.

commit_message:
Fix l7 objects quota increment on populated lb create

So far when l7policies and l7rules were created in a a single
populated LB create API call, their quota was not incremented due to a
lack of quota updates.

This patch adds the missing quota update calls.

Change-Id: Ic0305a693a579cdfb8c4b8bc93d750adbccc8fa3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/63/886263/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | Added a quota update call for l7 objects when they are created in a single populated LB create.

Adds bindep.txt to get CI working

commit_message:
Deprecating the Ingress Class Annotation

This PS prepares OSH charts for replacement of the  deprecated
kubernetes.io/ingress.class annotation  with spec.ingressClassName one
if k8s version >=1.18 made in helm-toolkit chart in osh-infra repo.

Helm-toolkit chart is going to be updated here:
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-helm-infra/+/891720

Change-Id: Ic1c4d84a56663f59e72000b27de2b2d3bdcfecab
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm refs/changes/06/892406/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
[ceph] Use Helm toolkit functions for Ceph probes

This change converts the readiness and liveness probes in the Ceph
charts to use the functions from the Helm toolkit rather than
having hard-coded probe definitions. This allows probe configs to
be overridden in values.yaml without rebuilding charts.

Change-Id: I68a01b518f12d33fe4f87f86494a5f4e19be982e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra refs/changes/23/891523/17 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
libvirt tsc_frequency

add tsc frequency option for invariant tsc migration

Change-Id: Ia64c194b69790d8c7d4a19b70c4441c06a8e03f3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/24/891924/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Live Migration With Invariant Time Stamp Counter (invtsc) ------------------------ .. versionadded:: 28.0.0 (2023.2 Bobcat) Libvirt supports live migration for VMs which utilize the invtsc flag as of version 3.2.0, but it's required to set the tsc frequency to enable this. Setting invtsc and attempting live migration without setting tsc frequency will result in `libvirtError: Requested operation is not valid: domain has CPU feature: invtsc` exception. The following configuration will enable invtsc and permit live migration using the libvirt driver. .. code-block:: ini [libvirt] cpu_model_extra_flags = +invtsc tsc_frequency = 1996250000 To determine the tsc frequency of a given libvirt hypervisor, one can check the output of `virsh capabilities`. Note that this value can change across reboots and it's not necessary for the value to match on source and destination hypervisors during live migration. .. code:: console $ virsh capabilities | grep frequency <counter name='tsc' frequency='1996250000' scaling='yes'/>

subject: Changed the DEFAULT_COMPUTE_API_VERSION value in the constants.py
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-08-22 16:39:11.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_common/constants.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common/commit/4d35a0a662ab5b2d21fa9fa46f870af016b1914f', 'message': "Changed the DEFAULT_COMPUTE_API_VERSION value in the constants.py

The default value defined for the variable DEFAULT_COMPUTE_API_VERSION
in the ~/.overcloudrc file generated by overcloudrc.py, which pulls
this variable value from constants.py, is '2.latest', but this
generates a warning message everytime a user uses this standard config
file, like this one below:

/usr/lib/python3.9/site-packages/openstack/config/cloud_region.py:452:
UserWarning: You have a configured API_VERSION with 'latest' in it.
In the context of openstacksdk this doesn't make any sense.
  warnings.warn(

commit_message:
Changed the DEFAULT_COMPUTE_API_VERSION value in the constants.py

The default value defined for the variable DEFAULT_COMPUTE_API_VERSION
in the ~/.overcloudrc file generated by overcloudrc.py, which pulls
this variable value from constants.py, is '2.latest', but this
generates a warning message everytime a user uses this standard config
file, like this one below:

/usr/lib/python3.9/site-packages/openstack/config/cloud_region.py:452:
UserWarning: You have a configured API_VERSION with 'latest' in it.
In the context of openstacksdk this doesn't make any sense.
  warnings.warn(

To avoid that, I changed the value '2.latest' to simply '2.1',
which is the current API version in use after a fresh install.

Change-Id: I2820285318005b069c82fa632cbb73ad68cd3dfd

Change-Id: I50c9912ddcc7a8ece22bbb871f018b5460e93c1e
Signed-off-by: Alexon Oliveira <alolivei@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/79/892379/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: DEFAULT_COMPUTE_API_VERSION = '2.1'

subject: Raise NotFound on update of inexistent resources
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-08-22 08:55:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/octavia/commit/bd760c073d7501ab77951d5324ffb163a0da50b2', 'message': 'Raise NotFound on update of inexistent resources

Some DB repository classes already raised NotFound on update of an
inexistent resources. Others just returned, but did not update anything.
This commit unifies the behavior by raising NotFound in all update
methods if no resource is found.

The missing check caused issues when two requests concurrently deleted
the same object. We encountered this for HealthMonitor resources, but
other resources are probably affected by the same issue.

1. The first request is received and the LB locked (=PENDING_UPDATE)
   and the HealthMonitor set to PENDING_DELETE. A 204 NO CONTENT
   response is sent to the client.

2. The second request is received while the health monitor still
   exists. Thus no immediate 404 NOT FOUND response is sent.

3. The health monitor deletion job finishes and the LB is unlocked
   (=ACTIVE).

4. The second request proceeds and is able to lock the LB
   (=PENDING_UPDATE). The health monitor repository update also
   succeeds, but does not update any object. A 204 NO CONTENT
   response is sent to the client.

5. The deletion job issued by the second request fails because the
   health monitor no longer exists in the database. Because this
   happens during setup of the deletion taskflow in the worker, no
   flow is started and the LB is stuck in the PENDING_UPDATE state.

With this change, the second health monitor DELETE request fails in step
4 and returns NotFound.

Change-Id: I4f858a71784ae640bb6b5eddf9347c7b70afa632

commit_message:
Raise NotFound on update of inexistent resources

Some DB repository classes already raised NotFound on update of an
inexistent resources. Others just returned, but did not update anything.
This commit unifies the behavior by raising NotFound in all update
methods if no resource is found.

The missing check caused issues when two requests concurrently deleted
the same object. We encountered this for HealthMonitor resources, but
other resources are probably affected by the same issue.

1. The first request is received and the LB locked (=PENDING_UPDATE)
   and the HealthMonitor set to PENDING_DELETE. A 204 NO CONTENT
   response is sent to the client.

2. The second request is received while the health monitor still
   exists. Thus no immediate 404 NOT FOUND response is sent.

3. The health monitor deletion job finishes and the LB is unlocked
   (=ACTIVE).

4. The second request proceeds and is able to lock the LB
   (=PENDING_UPDATE). The health monitor repository update also
   succeeds, but does not update any object. A 204 NO CONTENT
   response is sent to the client.

5. The deletion job issued by the second request fails because the
   health monitor no longer exists in the database. Because this
   happens during setup of the deletion taskflow in the worker, no
   flow is started and the LB is stuck in the PENDING_UPDATE state.

With this change, the second health monitor DELETE request fails in step
4 and returns NotFound.

This also fixes a hidden bug in Amphora health record update where a
exception was expected which never occurred.

Change-Id: I4f858a71784ae640bb6b5eddf9347c7b70afa632

commit_message:
Fix l7 objects quota decrement on lb cascade delete

So far l7policies and l7rules were deleted successfully on lb delete with the --cascade flag, but their quota was not decreased.

This patch fixes the quota so it would decrease correctly.

Change-Id: I3edb4f636f1f9b500f9a41f6dd3f932b171cd4f9

Open cinderlib for 2023.2 (Bobcat) development

See "cinderlib tox and zuul configuration maintenance" in
https://docs.openstack.org/cinderlib/latest/contributor/contributing.html

commit_message:
Use proper galera port in configuration

While <service>_galera_port is defined and used for db_setup
role, it's not in fact used in a connection string for oslo.db.

Change-Id: I41c2c8a50ff119cad4b8c1fe1e38096cc97f8c12

commit_message:
Remove deferred_auth_method and configure trustee user

deferred_auth_method=password is deprecated and should not be used
anymore.

A trustee needs to be configured for inter-services communication.

Change-Id: I440052fffa716c029f6bc6986c9593fe79cfc0b5

subject: Fix DB upgrade with using SQLAlchemy 2.x
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-08-23 14:36:50.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/Fix-metadata.bind-use-on-upgrade-3ca33425f341ac5b.yaml', 'designate/storage/sqlalchemy/alembic/legacy_utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/designate/commit/06482503881c89a709a1fe79c2c8d600244ad168', 'message': 'Fix DB upgrade with using SQLAlchemy 2.x

Sqlaclhemy metadata bind is deperecated from version 1.4 and will
be removed in SQLAlchemy 2.0 [1]. It can be easily replaced with
metadata reflect which works for SQLAlchemy 2.0.

Also current metadata.bind does not result in fetching all tables from
the database, so metadata.tables is an empty mapping, which leads
to db_sync failures.

[1] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/core/metadata.html#sqlalchemy.schema.MetaData.bind
[2] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/core/reflection.html#reflecting-all-tables-at-once

Co-Authored-By: Dmitriy Rabotyagov <noonedeadpunk@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I8c721722eeb36de64b8c8a79d4fdcec0e92388fa
'}]
commit_message:
Fix DB upgrade with using SQLAlchemy 2.x

Sqlaclhemy metadata bind is deperecated from version 1.4 and will
be removed in SQLAlchemy 2.0 [1]. It can be easily replaced with
metadata reflect which works for SQLAlchemy 2.0.

Also current metadata.bind does not result in fetching all tables from
the database, so metadata.tables is an empty mapping, which leads
to db_sync failures.

[1] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/core/metadata.html#sqlalchemy.schema.MetaData.bind
[2] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/core/reflection.html#reflecting-all-tables-at-once

Co-Authored-By: Dmitriy Rabotyagov <noonedeadpunk@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I8c721722eeb36de64b8c8a79d4fdcec0e92388fa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/43/892543/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: metadata.reflect(bind=op.get_bind())

commit_message:
Do not use deperecated MetaData.bind

Sqlaclhemy metadata bind is deperecated from version 1.4 and will
be removed in SQLAlchemy 2.0 [1]. It can be easily replaced with
metadata reflect which works for SQLAlchemy 2.0.

Also current metadata.bind does not result in fetching all tables from
the database, so metadata.tables is an empty mapping, which leads
to db_sync failures.

[1] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/core/metadata.html#sqlalchemy.schema.MetaData.bind
[2] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/core/reflection.html#reflecting-all-tables-at-once

Change-Id: I2b6f5f7e58567759b631baad87861d3a135f60fa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/87/892487/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: metadata.reflect(bind=op.get_bind())

subject: Release constraint for OVS/OVN versions for EL
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-08-23 15:59:27.000000000', 'files': ['vars/redhat-9.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/el_ovs_3.1_stable-951c1b8a148bbcaf.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-openstack_hosts/commit/c03d67297af1dc29b757c88ed9ac9e88ee20d4c8', 'message': 'Release constraint for OVS/OVN versions for EL

RDO has stopped building packages for older versions of OVS/OVN
which means that upstream fixes are not ending up in deployments.

We remove previously defined excludes as bugs related to
new versions were sorted out. At the same time we struggle from
old OVS bugs in CI.

Change-Id: I5be67c3a08645050187bee61e6a46f6b6f738604

commit_message:
Release constraint for OVS/OVN versions for EL

RDO has stopped building packages for older versions of OVS/OVN
which means that upstream fixes are not ending up in deployments.

We remove previously defined excludes as bugs related to
new versions were sorted out. At the same time we struggle from
old OVS bugs in CI.

Change-Id: I5be67c3a08645050187bee61e6a46f6b6f738604
Related-Bug: #2027854
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-openstack_hosts refs/changes/81/892581/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- upgrade: - | CentOS/Rocky linux deployments will get major update of OVS version from 2.17 to 3.1 and OVN from 22.12 to 23.03. RDO has stopped building packages for previous OVS/OVN versions which means they will not recieve any upstream bugfixes or security patches. If you still want to preserve old versions of OVS/OVN, you can define a following variable: ..code:: yaml openstack_hosts_package_repos: - name: rdo-deps file: rdo-deps description: rdo-deps baseurl: "{{ openstack_hosts_rdo_deps_url }}" gpgcheck: no module_hotfixes: yes exclude: - '*rdo-openvswitch*3.1*' - '*rdo-ovn*3.1*'

commit_message:
[workload] Make volume deletion more robust during vm cleanup.

First ensure that it's disassociated from the vm before deleting it
and add the --force option to delete it regardless of the status.

Resolved Conflicts:
	templates/workload_launch.sh.j2
Conflict is due to two patches[1][2] which are not cherry-picked from
wallaby to train branch.

[1]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-upgrade/+/873251
[2]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-upgrade/+/873254

Change-Id: I7a0a8015ca9068834ff17ddae1bb80734fc13fea
(cherry picked from commit 5de6e2c3aadd45b2e1e74d7ca7366f020f6cb1ab)

python3 doesn't allow to catch classes that do not inherit from
BaseException. As a result, nova is unable to catch and process
processutils.ProcessExecutionError exception raised by
nova.privsep.fs.mount() properly and TypeError is raised
instead.

This behavior has two consequences:

- nova doen't process the case when mount point actually exists;
- TypeError is raised instead of processutils.ProcessExecutionError.

"}]
commit_message:
Catch processutils exception by mount() properly

python3 doesn't allow to catch classes that do not inherit from
BaseException. As a result, nova is unable to catch and process
processutils.ProcessExecutionError exception raised by
nova.privsep.fs.mount() properly and TypeError is raised
instead.

This behavior has two consequences:

- nova doen't process the case when mount point actually exists;
- TypeError is raised instead of processutils.ProcessExecutionError.

This patch fixes this minor issue and introduces related unit test.

Closes-bug: #2032776
Change-Id: I51cb73c557d17fdb523718b31e96a9b619034dfd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/96/892496/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: DNM:Netapp ONTAP: Add support to revert to snapshot
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-06-14 13:38:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/85bd25448796952c54908877f3efd47134afe842', 'message': 'DNM:Netapp ONTAP: Add support to revert to snapshot

This patch adds support to revert to snapshot for NFS, FC and
iSCSI drivers with FlexVol pool.

Adds a method on client_cmode to rename a NFS volume file using
the file-rename-file zapi call.

The revert steps are:
  1. Create a clone volume file/LUN from snapshot.
  2. Change the original volume file/LUN path to a temporary path.
  3. Change clone file/LUN path to the original path.
  4. Delete the volume file/LUN on temporary path.

If any step fails, the original volume file/LUN is preserved and
the clone file/LUN is deleted.

For NFS, ONTAP clone file is not supported on FlexGroup pool, in
this case the generic implementation will perform the revert to
snapshot.

Implements: blueprint ontap-revert-to-snapshot
Co-Authored-By: Fabio Oliveira <fabioaurelio1269@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I347f0ee63d8d13ff181dd41a542a006b7c10b488

commit_message:
DNM:Netapp ONTAP: Add support to revert to snapshot

This patch adds support to revert to snapshot for NFS, FC and
iSCSI drivers with FlexVol pool.

Adds a method on client_cmode to rename a NFS volume file using
the file-rename-file zapi call.

The revert steps are:
  1. Create a clone volume file/LUN from snapshot.
  2. Change the original volume file/LUN path to a temporary path.
  3. Change clone file/LUN path to the original path.
  4. Delete the volume file/LUN on temporary path.

If any step fails, the original volume file/LUN is preserved and
the clone file/LUN is deleted.

For NFS, ONTAP clone file is not supported on FlexGroup pool, in
this case the generic implementation will perform the revert to
snapshot.

Implements: blueprint ontap-revert-to-snapshot
Co-Authored-By: Fabio Oliveira <fabioaurelio1269@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I347f0ee63d8d13ff181dd41a542a006b7c10b488
(cherry picked from commit 1f96b386b35841c181c390a199c80487fde41b5d)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/97/886097/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def migrate_volume(self, context, volume, host): return self.library.migrate_volume(context, volume, host) def revert_to_snapshot(self, context, volume, snapshot): return self.library.revert_to_snapshot(volume, snapshot)

commit_message:
Add docs key and point at Discourse

Add the 'docs' key and point it at a Discourse topic
previously populated with the charm's README contents.

When the new charm revision is released to the Charmhub,
this Discourse-based content will be displayed there. In
the absense of the this new key, the Charmhub's default
behaviour is to display the value of the charm's
'description' key.

Change-Id: Ia36919df21c55bfc40497f7c174ba5919f44a394
(cherry picked from commit 3ac03519788ee52797d06e2cc0ad7d773615dc91)

commit_message:
Switch to PyMemcacheCache backend

The new library is already supported in django 3.2 and gives us better
support for IPv6 addresses and encrypted connections.

Also, the same library is being used by all other OpenStack projects.

Change-Id: I964ac4d0d62dff4c1f7c1f1373763fbf23024269

commit_message:
SQLAlchemy: add context wrappers to SFC driver

With SQLAlchemy > 2.0.0 the unit tests of networking-bagpipe
are unstable.
The failure looks like some session violance, but more work
is necessary as I still can't see where the root of the issue is.

Change-Id: I5633d067e6ae4d9de89888a2587470715cd7b506
Related-Bug: #1964575

commit_message:
Add python 3.11 unit test job

Python 3.11 is going to be added as required
python version testing[1] so testing it in
advance is good idea.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/2024.1.html#python-runtimes-for-2024-1

Change-Id: I77c51657d67b644ece30589f26bb795929f25bc4

Backport support for access rules

This patch is a charm-helpers sync to get the fixes
application credential access-rules.

commit_message:
Pin tox to < 4.0.0

Tox 4.0.0 was recently released and it has several breaking changes.
We pin to < 4.0.0 here. We are planning to move forward only on the
master charm branches.

Tox is also pinned to < 4.0.0 for stable branches in upstream
openstack-zuul-jobs as well as in zosci-config. However, the
requires= section in the charm's tox.ini file ends up installing
tox>4, wiping out the zuul-pinned tox<4 that was already installed
installed. This patch fixes that.

Related-Bug: #2002788
Change-Id: Ie846026bec91198f5db9d0a591ee1ba911d13067

Backport support for access rules

This patch is a charm-helpers sync to get the fixes
application credential access-rules.

commit_message:
Use an external compiler for scss files

Since django-sass is not supported anymore, we need to explore
alternatives. This patch makes django-compress use an external
program to compile sass files.

Note: this requires that rubygem-sass is installed and in path.

Change-Id: I0a4afaff0fd701ac37f15713ae9ca6097c8191b0

DNM: Test gate with GLOBAL_VENV=true

broken by devstack change [1] which change to uses venv.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/558930

commit_message:
Stop reffering _member_ role

Keystone has stopped providing or reffering `_member_` role for a while,
thus role should not be refferenced anymore.

Moreover, with 2023.1 service policies have dropped `_member_`
which resulted in the role to be insufficient for basic operations.

Change-Id: I08be0504b6408132b56493d6b38c485a95b413eb
Related-Bug: #2029486

commit_message:
Backport support for access rules

This patch is a charm-helpers sync to get the fixes
application credential access-rules.

Change-Id: I064300a3a8deddf49111825eddc7d08d964d4d67
Related-Bug: #1965967

commit_message:
Fix linters and metadata

With update of ansible-lint to version >=6.0.0 a lot of new
linters were added, that enabled by default. In order to comply
with linter rules we're applying changes to the role.

With that we also update metdata to reflect current state.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ansible-role-systemd_service/+/888223
Change-Id: I558a0fee0b0bf8c86f5bd73dca2b9571f3e4e287

commit_message:
Enable HTTP/2 for TLS-covered frontends

In case all frontend VIPs are covered with TLS, it makes total
sense to enable HTTP/2 to speedup services, as according to the [1],
TLS adds significant overhead to HAProxy that can be solved by
enabling HTTP/2 on frontends.

We don't enable HTTP/2 in other cases, since with non-TLS covered
frontends it is not possible to support multiple versions of HTTP
simultaneously [2]

[1] https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/openstack-ansible-tls-performance-impact
[2] https://www.haproxy.com/documentation/hapee/latest/load-balancing/protocols/http-2/

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible-haproxy_server/+/891572
Change-Id: I88ab8819979509ffd1582f06be85d127e93ac47f

commit_message:
Use correct default for glance_mount_points

Back in Yoga we've refactored way of mounting remote filesystems
for glance while keeping backwards compatibiltiy [1]

However, there was a copy/paste error made while defining
glance_mount_points with old format of glance_nfs_client.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_glance/+/837550

Change-Id: I755822089bf406f532a718db5b84df553cbc2084
Closes-Bug: #2032771

Install mysqlclient devel package

Having mysqlclient devel is required to sucessbully build
and install mysqlclient python package inside virtualenv.

commit_message:
Fix wrong neutron_ml2_drivers_type

neutron_ml2_drivers_type is a string, not a list, while default
value for it is a list. Local settings also assume that it is a list.

So we ensure that the falue is a string by default now and
treat it as string in the code.

Change-Id: Ida72c712153dcda4cd06e0959f98ade4fee8dfbd
(cherry picked from commit 5d635c469af4e9c9bb85615257e3bb3738ce3a29)
